Class LanguagesLoader

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class LanguagesLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class used for manage i18n languages
    Author:
    Andrea Bori

    • Constructor Detail

        public LanguagesLoader()

    • Method Detail

      • loadLang

        public static void loadLang(java.lang.String langsFile)
                     throws LangNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Load a list of languages from a langFile
        Parameters:
        langsFile - the source of languages file where all languages are stored
        Throws:
        LangNotFoundException - throw in case of one languages cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - throw when something with parsing went wrong, like interrupted

      • validateLanguages

        public static void validateLanguages()
                              throws UnmatchedLanguagesException
        Validate all languages, if one or more languages fail the match, it will throw UnmatchedLanguagesException
        Throws:
        UnmatchedLanguagesException - in case of one or more languages fail the matching test between theme self

      • getLang

        public static Lang getLang(java.lang.String langName)
                    throws LangNotFoundException
        Get a specific languages, if no languages where found it will thrown LangNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        langName - the name of the requested ( and registered ) language
        Returns:
        Language object
        Throws:
        LangNotFoundException - throw it in case of languages not found inside the registry

      • getWord

        public static java.lang.String getWord(java.lang.String lang,
                                       java.lang.String word)
                                throws WordNotFoundException,
                                       LangNotFoundException
        Fast access to a word from the LanguagesLoader class, require directly the langName that used for call getLang(String) and then the word that will be used to call the getWord(String, String) method and retrieve the word corresponding to the Lang required
        Parameters:
        lang - languages name ( example: "it" or "it-IT"
        word - the requested word
        Returns:
        String the corresponding word the the requested languages
        Throws:
        WordNotFoundException - throw in case of no word found inside given languages
        LangNotFoundException - throw in case of no languages found inside registry
